revised_title: Effects of X-Rays on Meiotic Division in Orthoptera
tldr: The article investigates the effects of X-rays on the first meiotic division in three species of orthoptera. The results show that X-ray exposure causes changes in chromosome behavior, leading to abnormal anaphase separation and fusion of chromosomes. This indicates that X-rays can have detrimental effects on meiosis and potentially affect the fertility of the organisms.
